summary: A letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to the Metropolitan Detention Center, transmitting discovery materials to inmate Ghislaine Maxwell for her access in connection with her criminal case.

persons.name: Ghislaine Maxwell
persons.context: The subject of the criminal case and the inmate to whom discovery materials are being provided.

persons.name: Audrey Strauss
persons.context: The author of the letter, transmitting discovery materials on behalf of the U.S. Attorney's Office.

connections.description: Strauss, as a prosecutor, is corresponding with the detention center to provide discovery to the defendant Maxwell.

events.title: Discovery Transmission to Maxwell
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office sends discovery materials to the Metropolitan Detention Center for inmate Ghislaine Maxwell's access.

locations: U.S. Department of Justice, Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, NY 10007
Metropolitan Detention Center, 80 29th Street, Brooklyn, NY 11232
keyFacts: The document is a formal correspondence dated November 9, 2020, from the U.S. Attorney's Office.
It pertains to the criminal case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
Its purpose is to transmit discovery materials to Ghislaine Maxwell while she is incarcerated at the Metropolitan Detention Center in Brooklyn.
